intro: Aeschynomene nyikensis, commonly known as African leadplant, is a flowering plant species native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets. Aeschynomene nyikensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid environments.
